Key Match Events: Wales started the game as the more aggressive and competent side, leading 2-0 at halftime.
Substitutions and an intense press from Iceland saw them turn the game around, with Logi Tomasson scoring twice to draw level.
From there, Wales were clinging on and managed to keep out the hosts to earn a draw.
Post-Match Reflections: Another match without defeat for Craig Bellamy but plenty to work on for Wales.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a total game of two halves.
Logi Tomasson is the hero of the game after coming off the bench to score twice and bring Iceland back into the game.
